DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Post Surgery Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes no indicator related to whether the patient will undergo an MRI post surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Post Surgery Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.
